snippet: With a beaming Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo presiding, state officials held a Yogurt Summit to strategize with industry leaders about how to help ensure that the fast-growing industry continued to prosper.
abstract: Dozens of dairy farmers, food industry executives, politicians and reporters gather for official 'New York State Yogurt Summit' in Albany; Gov Andrew M Cuomo has been a vocal champion of the yogurt industry, which has emerged as a rare growth sector in economically struggling upstate areas; industry has been growing because of exploding popularity of Greek-style yogurt, which requires significantly more milk to produce than regular yogurt, and which has benefited from a proximity to New York's dairy farms.
lead_paragraph: With a beaming Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo presiding, state officials held a Yogurt Summit to strategize with industry leaders about how to help ensure that the fast-growing industry continued to prosper.

headline.seo: In Albany, Hopes of Making New York a Yogurt Empire
headline.main: In Albany, Hopes of Making New York State a Yogurt Empire
headline.print_headline: In Albany, Hopes of Making New York State a Yogurt Empire
